response.summary: My biggest dream ever has been to become an inventor, and every day I am a step closer to getting it. I am bursting with a child's curiosity, a lifelong learning spirit, and keen social awareness. While exploring new fields, I got a taste for coding, an interest in sustainable development, and a passion for teaching. I am firmly convinced of the social purpose of my career and its role in society's advance. I am the one creative, adept, and willing you seek after.
response.skills: Navisworks, Stakeholder Engagement, Revit Training, Quality Management, Architectural Drawings, People Management, Business Relationship Management, Microsoft Excel, Revit, AutoCAD, Building Information Modeling (BIM), Sustainable Development, Sustainability, Business Communications, Comunicación escrita, Visual Basic para aplicaciones (VBA), CAD/CAM, Architectural Design, Construction Management, Teamwork

profile_positions.title: Railway systems and equipment BIM Coordinator

profile_positions.description: On charge of create internal standards for products, practices and processes. Head of quality management and quality assurance. Head of internal education program. Developed KPI's, performance strategies and data analysis.
profile_positions.title: BIM Lead

company.name: WSP in the UK
company.description:
WSP is a leading engineering professional services consulting firm which supports significant projects in both the built and natural environments. We provide engineering and design services to public and private sector clients in the transportation and infrastructure, property and buildings, earth and environment, power and energy, resources and industry sectors, as well as a strategic advisory offering.

We have more than 40 offices across the UK and Ireland. Our team of over 7,000 technical specialists and strategic advisers in the UK is part of a talented family of more than 55,000 global changemakers, transforming what’s possible to build a smarter, greener future for all.  Together, we deliver innovative solutions to solve complex problems for our clients and the communities we serve, meeting both the needs of today and addressing the challenges of tomorrow.

WSP takes pride in leading the way we collectively tackle the climate emergency and in October 2020 we announced our commitment to halve the carbon footprint of all designs and advice provided to clients by 2030, a first in the engineering consultancy sector. Having since aligned our carbon reduction targets with the SBTI’s science-based Net-Zero Standard, we will achieve carbon neutrality in our UK operations in 2025. Globally, WSP has committed to achieving net zero emissions across its value chain by 2040.
